definition: To provide a sense of fullness or satisfaction to someone or something, often used in the context of feeding or nourishing.

examples.german: Er hat sich am Buffet sattgemacht.
examples.english: He filled up at the buffet.
We can eat our fill here.

examples.german: Sie haben sich an den Süßigkeiten sattgemacht.
Sattgemacht und zufrieden verließen sie das Restaurant.
examples.english: Having eaten their fill, they left the restaurant satisfied.
